trivia.fact: Did you know? 'January' is named after Janus, the Roman god with two faces - one looking back at the old year and one forward to the new
Etymology: 'Deadline' originally meant a line drawn around a prison - if prisoners crossed it, they'd be shot
Word origin: 'Algorithm' comes from the name of 9th-century Persian mathematician Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi
Fun fact: 'Salary' comes from Latin 'salarium' - money given to Roman soldiers to buy salt, which was valuable
Did you know? 'Robot' comes from Czech 'robota' meaning forced labor, first used in a 1920 play

note: This file contains curated trivia but is not actively used. The service fetches from APIs instead.
